sections.heading: Exceptions
sections.text: 826.02 Exceptions.—The provisions of s. 826.01 shall not extend to any person:

sections.heading: Knowingly marrying husband or wife of another.
sections.text: marrying husband or wife of another.

sections.heading: Incest
sections.text: 826.04 Incest.—Whoever knowingly marries or has sexual intercourse with a person to whom he or she is related by lineal consanguinity, or a brother, sister, uncle, aunt, nephew, or niece, commits incest, which constitutes a felony of the third degree, punishable as provided in s. 775.082, s. 775.083, or s. 775.084. “Sexual intercourse” is the penetration of the female sex organ by the male sex organ, however slight; emission of semen is not required.

sections.heading: Exceptions. The provisions of s. 826.01 shall not extend to any person:(1)Who reasonably believes that the prior spouse is dead
sections.text: (2)Whose prior spouse has voluntarily deserted him or her and remained absent for the space of 3 years continuously, the party marrying again not knowing the other to be living within
